description: Mealtimes are periods of learning, love and interaction, and promotes physical, social and emotional development.
title: Mealtimes are periods of learning, love and interaction, and promotes physical, social and emotional development
content:
- Feeding time offers mothers and fathers or other caregivers the
   opportunity to talk with children and support their learning. This
   helps to stimulate a child’s social and emotional growth and
   development.

 - When feeding, children should be encouraged to eat. Do not force-feed
   them.

 - If a child refuses to eat a variety of foods, experiment with
   different food combinations, tastes, textures and methods of
   encouragement.

 - Minimise distractions during meals if the child loses interest
   easily.

 - Infants need to be fed directly. Young children can be assisted when
   they are learning to eat themselves.

 - Both mothers and fathers must be responsible for their child’s
   nutrition. Both parents should take part in feeding their daughters
   and sons.
